stance_1: Animal products are prominent in stores
stance_2: Meat is the path of least resistance
justification: The interviewee explicitly connects the prominence of animal products in stores to meat being the path of least resistance.

stance_2: Meat is cost prohibitive for me
justification: The interviewee directly states that not buying meat is due to its cost being prohibitive.

stance_2: I meet nutritional needs without meat
justification: The interviewee states they can meet nutritional needs without meat, supporting their choice not to buy meat.
The desire to not take animal lives supports the choice not to buy meat.

stance_1: I meet nutritional needs without meat
justification: Meeting nutritional needs without meat is consistent with valuing animal life, reducing harm to animals.

stance_2: My housemates eat meat at every meal
justification: The interviewee's choice not to buy meat contrasts with housemates who eat meat at every meal.

stance_2: My reasons for avoiding meat are met with scorn
justification: The interviewee's stance not to buy meat is maintained despite facing scorn, suggesting reinforcement of conviction.

stance_2: My housemates eat meat at every meal
justification: Valuing animal life conflicts with housemates eating meat at every meal.

stance_2: My reasons for avoiding meat are met with scorn
justification: The interviewee's value for animal life is part of the reason their stance receives scorn, reinforcing their conviction.

stance_1: Meat is the path of least resistance
stance_2: My housemates eat meat at every meal
justification: The housemates' consistent meat-eating reflects the idea that eating meat is the path of least resistance.

stance_1: Meat is the path of least resistance
stance_2: My reasons for avoiding meat are met with scorn
justification: The scorn the interviewee receives for avoiding meat is implicitly supported by the norm of meat being the path of least resistance.
